edu.colorado.cs.ngn.lime.api

Class LimeAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.colorado.cs.ngn.lime.api.LimeAPI

  • @Path(value="")
public class LimeAPI
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that implements the embedded HTTP API API documentation available in the method javadocs. Assumes that the http api is running on http://localhost:9000 Replace localhost:9000 with the url and port used in production, if different, to make api calls
    Author:
    Michael Coughlin

      • finishMigration

        @GET
@Path(value="/finishMigration/{DPID}")
@Produces(value="text/plain")
public java.lang.String finishMigration(@PathParam(value="DPID")
                                                 java.lang.String DPID)
        HTTP GET request http://localhost:9000/finishMigration/ Use this API call to signal that a given switch DPID is finished migrating. Replace in the path with the hex string of the given switch's DPID. Example: http://localhost:9000/finishMigration/00:00:00:00:00:00:00:00
        Parameters:
        DPID - The dpid to signal that migration has finished on
        Returns:
        String to print to webpage

      • config

        @POST
@Path(value="/config")
@Produces(value="text/plain")
@Consumes(value="application/x-www-form-urlencoded")
public java.lang.String config(java.lang.String data)
        HTTP POST request http://localhost:9000/config Use this API call to pass JSON configuration strings to Lime. Note that the config is passed as the data in an HTTP POST request. Currently, this API call only handles switch configurations, but may be expanded to other options in the future. To configure a switch, the JSON configuration must be of the form:
        {
        "": <-- Replace with the DPID of the switch to configure
        {
        "ports":
        {
        "" : <-- Replace with the value of the switch port to configure
        {
        "type" : "", <--Must be one of the valid values in the enum edu.colorado.cs.ngn.lime.util.PortType. Replace with this value
        "mac" : "" <--optional. Must be provided if the type == H_CONNECTED, otherwise is ignored
        },
        "" :
        {
        "type" : "DUMMY" <--Note that a dummy port must always be provided
        }
        }
        "original":"" <--Optional. Used to identify the original switch of a clone switch. If this is provided, the switch is a clone. Otherwise is an original. Replace with the switch DPID.
        }
        }
        Parameters:
        data - The JSON configuration data
        Returns:
        String to print to webpage

      • migrateVM

        @POST
@Path(value="/migrateVM")
@Produces(value="text/plain")
@Consumes(value="application/x-www-form-urlencoded")
public java.lang.String migrateVM(java.lang.String data)
        HTTP POST request http://localhost:9000/migrateVM Use this API call to initiate a VM migration. Note that the config is passed as the data in an HTTP POST request. The JSON string passed to migrate a VM must be of this form:
        {
        "originalHost" : "", <-- replace with the IP address of the source libvirt hypervisor
        "destinationHost" : "", <-- replace with the IP address of the destination libvirt hypervisor
        "domain" : "", <-- replace with the name of the libvirt domain to be migrated
        "originalDpid" : "", <-- replace with the DPID that the domain was originally connected to
        "cloneDpid" : "", <-- replace with the DPID that the domain will be connected to after migration
        "connectedPort" : "", <-- replace with the port that the domain was connected to on the original switch before migration
        "clonePort" : "" <-- NOTE that this parameter is inconsistently used currently, but is needed for compatibility and will be used in future. replace with the port the domain will be connected to on the clone switch after migration. please ensure that it is the same value as for now
        }
        Parameters:
        data - The JSON configuration data
        Returns:
        String to print to webpage
